Matamata RSA backtracks, apologises ‘unreservedly’ for blackface incident at quiz night https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/matamata-rsa-backtracks-apologises-unreservedly-for-blackface-incident-at-quiz-night/HWKVVJFITNDDBFAZIXYEG4ER5Y/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/matamata-rsa-backtracks-apologises-unreservedly-for-blackface-incident-at-quiz-night/HWKVVJFITNDDBFAZIXYEG4ER5Y/ David Williams“We did not pick up that it had the potential to offend." Pass wide and slow: Waikato horse riders battle for recognition as vulnerable road users https://www.nzherald.co.nz/waikato-news/news/pass-wide-and-slow-waikato-horse-riders-battle-for-recognition-as-vulnerable-road-users/OUSWY777QFD7BIAIVCMSLQ3VS4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/waikato-news/news/pass-wide-and-slow-waikato-horse-riders-battle-for-recognition-as-vulnerable-road-users/OUSWY777QFD7BIAIVCMSLQ3VS4/ Malisha Kumar“We are legally allowed on the road and should be able to do so safely.” Tue, 17 Sep 2024 23:39:57 +0000 Fiona Scott and six others of Waikato took part in the global movement that aims to educate drivers on how to pass horse riders safely on the road.
Injured climbers remain trapped on Mt Cook after night at high altitude https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/injured-climbers-remain-trapped-on-mt-cook-after-night-at-high-altitude/UARR3A6MUBCIBBBHWHBJYYTZCE/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/injured-climbers-remain-trapped-on-mt-cook-after-night-at-high-altitude/UARR3A6MUBCIBBBHWHBJYYTZCE/ The injured pair spent the night high up the mountain, hemmed in by bad weather. Ariki Rigby: Man accused of murder appears in court as family cry https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/ariki-rigby-man-accused-of-murder-appears-in-court-as-family-cry/PGVHG6HQRNARZAU2MDVBN5TFEY/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/ariki-rigby-man-accused-of-murder-appears-in-court-as-family-cry/PGVHG6HQRNARZAU2MDVBN5TFEY/ Isaac DavisonPolice made a breakthrough two years after the Hawke's Bay killing shocked the nation. Tue, 17 Sep 2024 23:04:34 +0000 Ariki Rigby was killed in September 2022, now a man will appear in court charged with her murder. Photo / Supplied
Mum-of-four on losing her husband to blood cancer: ‘The kids are working through big feelings’ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/mum-of-four-on-losing-her-husband-to-blood-cancer-the-kids-are-working-through-big-feelings/M575AOTZ4VBN3HCO3ZOHBPJY7E/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/mum-of-four-on-losing-her-husband-to-blood-cancer-the-kids-are-working-through-big-feelings/M575AOTZ4VBN3HCO3ZOHBPJY7E/ Nicholas JonesEvery day eight New Zealanders are diagnosed with a form of blood cancer. Tue, 17 Sep 2024 23:02:18 +0000 Libby Clark with her children Eleanor (left), twins Liam (centre) and Jacob (right), and oldest Ethan. Simon Clark passed away in June due to multiple myeloma, and his family are now set to be part of the 'Shine for a Cure' event, the first lantern ceremony of its kind to raise critical funds for New Zealanders impacted by blood cancer. Photographed at home in Te Atatu. Photo / Sylvie Whinray
